skill.name: Git Workflow Skill
skill.description: Git workflow management including branch validation, commit conventions, PR preparation, and repository health checks.
skill.summary: Git workflow management including branch validation, commit conventions, PR preparation, and reposit...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. The skill provides templates and guidance for git workflows.

content.value_statement: This skill helps developers follow consistent git workflows with branch naming conventions, conventional commit messages, and pull request templates. It automates PR description generation and validates repository health.
actual_capabilities: Validate branch naming conventions with type prefixes
Generate pull request descriptions from templates
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly
Requires manual git command execution by user

use_cases.title: Maintain clean commit history
use_cases.description: Follow conventional commit standards and keep branch names descriptive and consistent across personal projects

use_cases.title: Enforce team git standards
use_cases.description: Create consistent branch and commit conventions across team members with automated validation

use_cases.title: Streamline PR reviews
use_cases.description: Generate standardized pull request descriptions and checklists for better contribution management

prompt_templates.title: Check current branch
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the current branch and does it follow the naming convention?

prompt_templates.title: Create feature branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a feature branch for implementing user authentication following the branch naming convention

prompt_templates.title: Prepare commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a conventional commit message for adding user login functionality with a scope of auth

prompt_templates.title: Generate PR description
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a pull request description template for the new feature branch that includes summary and test plan

output_examples.input: Generate a pull request description for adding dark mode support
output: Added dark mode support with theme toggle in settings
- Check all pages render in dark mode

best_practices: Always create feature branches from main or develop rather than committing directly
Use semantic branch prefixes like feat/, fix/, docs/ to indicate change type
Write conventional commit messages with type, scope, and description for changelog automation
anti_patterns: Committing directly to main or master branches
Using vague branch names like 'update' or 'fix-stuff' without descriptive slugs
Skipping PR descriptions and leaving checklist items incomplete

faq.question: Which git platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and any Git-based repository hosting service.

faq.question: What are the supported branch types?
faq.answer: feat, fix, docs, refactor, perf, test, chore, and hotfix prefixes are supported.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: The skill generates conventional commits that work with semantic-release and other automated versioning tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance templates. It does not read, write, or modify any repository files directly.

faq.question: Why is my branch rejected?
faq.answer: Branches must follow the {type}/{descriptive-slug} format with lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only.

faq.question: How is this different from git CLI?
faq.answer: This skill provides intelligent guidance and templates. You still run git commands manually in your terminal.
